stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on practical implementation work in Course 14’s craft-snow section: tweaking styrofoam scenery, coding a spring-triggered cardboard bridge, adding homing paper–snowball hazards, and prototyping falling paper-snow confetti. He also explains global redesigns to coins, stars and the upcoming playable demo.

development_findings.summary: Red coins are now restricted to one sub-area per course to remove tedious scavenging.
development_findings.quote: Red coins in this game are always contained to one area because otherwise red coins suck.

development_findings.summary: A seventh ‘Find the Egg Coins’ star appears automatically after the first six stars; it uses a proximity radar to encourage thorough exploration.
development_findings.quote: There's seven acts now and once you have the first six stars you get the seventh star which is just find the egg coins.

development_findings.summary: 100-coin stars are completely removed to keep players from being forced into coin grinds.
development_findings.quote: No level has a 100 coin star, not a single one.

development_findings.summary: Global coins will normally fund overworld progression, but the demo will feature a placeholder NPC who trades three donations for purely cosmetic hat upgrades.
development_findings.quote: For the demo there's just gonna be one guy… you can gift me your coins and I will buy myself a new hat and that's it—you get nothing.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 bridge: a cardboard slab extends after a switch press, stays briefly, then retracts; speed ramps up as it returns.
development_findings.quote: Press the switch, the bridge comes out, and then it slowly goes back… I think that would be a good way to make this work.

development_findings.summary: Snowball hazard is modeled as crumpled paper spheres that spawn on a timer and track Mario’s lateral position.
development_findings.quote: I think it should just be paper squares that snow… literally crumpled up paper coming out of there.

development_findings.summary: Leaf particle system is repurposed to spawn small white paper-snowflake quads within a defined volume for ambient snowfall.
development_findings.quote: We could just reuse the leaf effect actually… then it would just be white triangles with vertex normals.

development_findings.summary: Kaze chose Godot over Unreal for his future original game because of faster iteration, leaner performance and simpler console porting.
development_findings.quote: I've decided that if I'm gonna make my own game, we are probably using Godot… Unreal Engine is so goddamn slow.

development_findings.summary: Demo roadmap: BLJ video, ‘what am I doing’ video, then a refreshed Course 1 demo targeted for release in a few weeks to quell constant date requests.
development_findings.quote: The demo release is gonna be in a few weeks… it's just gonna be there to show people the improvements that have been made since the last demo.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prioritised productivity over entertainment this stream and is comfortable live-streaming everyday tasks like workouts.
context_findings.quote: My priority today is not on entertaining but rather on getting work done… I guess I'm just having a side trip with working out and cooking a lot.

context_findings.summary: He views many classic SM64 missions (e.g., dispersed red/100-coin stars) as design failures and aims to ‘fix’ them for modern players.
Kaze casually joked about ignoring a 2019 Nintendo DMCA, highlighting ongoing legal tightrope of ROM-hack projects.
context_findings.quote: In 2019 I received a legit DMCA… and I responded suck my cock… I should be in prison right now.

context_findings.summary: He routinely exercises during long dev streams, citing physical fitness as beneficial for mental focus.

biobak.summary: Re-worked the ‘zoo’ Yoshi-coin icons and provides ongoing feedback on new styrofoam textures and craft aesthetics.
biobak.quote: Biobak did rework the zoo ones yes.

biobak.summary: Kaze asked Biobak to create a new, higher-quality exclamation box model/texture.

zeina.summary: Will create polished textures for the matchbox bridge when Kaze’s placeholder art is done.
zeina.quote: I might ask Zeina to make a good version of it.

zeina.summary: Appeared on stream with the couple’s baby, illustrating personal-professional overlap during development.

key_stories.title: Reinventing Coin & Star Structure
key_stories.summary: Kaze explains the complete overhaul of Mario 64’s coin/star economy—adding Yoshi coins and a radar-based Egg Coin star while deleting 100-coin stars.
key_stories.challenge: Original SM64 coin missions felt tedious and punished exploration.
key_stories.process: Introduced global Yoshi coins for ‘special interactions,’ confined red coins to single areas, added a radar-guided seventh star.
key_stories.outcome: Levels encourage organic exploration without forced grinds; system is ready for playtesting.
key_stories.key_quote: I wanted to solve the issue that there's no reason to explore all the nooks and crannies in a level.

key_stories.title: Cardboard Bridge Mechanism
key_stories.summary: Course 14 needed a temporary bridge across styrofoam cliffs. Kaze designed a cardboard slab that extends on a timer.
key_stories.challenge: Provide time-pressured traversal without visible machinery.
key_stories.process: Modeled matchbox-style rails, scripted movement speed that accelerates on retraction, fine-tuned collision and timing.
key_stories.outcome: Functional prototype in-game; visual polish (textures, sounds) still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: If it unrolled you wouldn't even see it… so spend five hours on a cool effect no one's gonna see? No.

key_stories.title: Paper Snowball Hazard
key_stories.summary: To match the craft motif, falling snowballs were reconceived as crumpled paper that home toward Mario.
key_stories.challenge: Need a thematic, low-poly hazard that looks good on N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Modeled irregular spheres, coded global-timer spawn, randomized lateral offsets and rotation, adjusted hitboxes and shadows.
key_stories.outcome: Working hazard with consistent tempo; Kaze plans to add a better spawn source (trash bin or sky).
key_stories.key_quote: That really does look like crumpled up paper.

key_stories.title: Demo Hat-Upgrade NPC
key_stories.summary: Lacking finished overworld shops for the demo, Kaze invents an NPC who only wants player coins for personal hats.
key_stories.challenge: Provide a use for global coins in a short demo build.
key_stories.process: Designed dialogue and three-stage visual upgrade (bronze→silver→gold) with no gameplay reward.
key_stories.outcome: Demo gives players an optional coin sink and showcases the global-coin system without full overworld features.
key_stories.key_quote: You give him coins and you do that three times… you get nothing, the guy just gets a cool hat.

key_stories.title: Engine Pivot to Godot
key_stories.summary: For a future original game, Kaze leans toward Godot after consulting Godot-left.
key_stories.challenge: Unreal Engine’s compile times and bloat hamper hobby-scale development.
key_stories.process: Discussed pros/cons live; emphasised faster iteration, better low-end performance, easier console ports.
key_stories.outcome: Not a firm commitment for Yoshi hack, but indicates tech direction for post-hack projects.
key_stories.key_quote: It's gonna be a lot more viable for development than Unreal Engine because Unreal Engine is so goddamn slow.
